definition: to reach/to arrive
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
surname Da
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
arrival hall
It is better to travel hopefully than to arrive.
pinyin: dai4 zhe5 xi1 wang4 qu4 lu:3 xing2 , bi3 dao4 da2 zhong1 dian3 geng4 mei3 hao3
containing_words.word: 帶著希望去旅行，比到達終點更美好

sentences.english: This event long antedates the arrival of Columbus in America.
sentences.chinese: 這件事的發生遠在哥倫布到達美洲之前。

sentences.english: I think we'll just make it if we hurry up!
sentences.chinese: 如果抓點緊，我想我們能及時到達。

sentences.english: We climbed to the top after an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我們爬了一個多小時纔到達山頂。

sentences.english: When did you arrive in London?
sentences.chinese: 我們什麼時候到達下一站？

sentences.english: M. and arrive there two hours later.
sentences.chinese: 我們早上六點半就上火車，兩小時後到達。

sentences.english: When I arrived in Yarmouth , I went straight to Barkis's house.
sentences.chinese: 到達雅茅斯後，我徑直來到了巴克斯家。

sentences.english: If I were you, however, I would go south for one more league , and then take the fork west.
sentences.chinese: 我要是你，我就再向南走三英里，到達岔路後向西。

sentences.english: The train arrived on the dot of three o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 那輛火車三點鐘準時到達。

sentences.english: After arriving in Switzerland, the imported raw cocoa is subject to a strict quality control.
sentences.chinese: 當可可豆到達瑞士後，將要進行嚴格的質控程序。

sentences.english: On arriving at the station, he found his wife waiting to meet him.
sentences.chinese: 他一到達車站，立即發現他的妻子在等着迎接他。

sentences.english: At a Chinese party the guests usually arrive 5-10 minutes early.
sentences.chinese: 中餐宴會客人凡是提前五至非常鍾到達。

sentences.english: I guess we should get there no later than 7:00.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們到達那裏不會遲於7點。

sentences.english: The owner of a race horse is always glad to see his colors get to the winning post.
sentences.chinese: 賽馬的主人總是高興看到他的標幟到達終點。

sentences.english: Arrive before the crowds of spectators and determine the best vantage point.
sentences.chinese: 要在不可計數的觀衆之前到達並決定最好的有利位置。

sentences.english: After they rode their bikes for two and a half hours, they arrived at the Ming Tombs.
sentences.chinese: 在他們騎車兩個半小時後，他們到達了明陵。

sentences.english: If we want to "get somewhere" in life, this is Saturn talking.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們想到達生命中的某處，這便是土星在發話。

definition: to arrive/to reach (a destination)
to go nonstop to/through (as in "through train")/nonstop
to set off/to start (on a journey)
travel time/expected time for a car journey
to depart/to leave
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to enter/to join/to go into
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
airport/airfield/CL:家[jia1],處|处[chu4]
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
the end/end point/finishing line (in a race)/destination/terminus/CL:個|个[ge4]
to enter
rail station/bus stop/CL:處|处[chu4],個|个[ge4]
to look around/to tour/to visit
half hour
(to take) a turn for the better/to change planes
